text: ...which is his right name, and refusedto answer to the name of Strelnikov.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: On his way to execution,he took a pistol from one of the guards...
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l think l know Lara at least as well as you.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: But don`t you see her position?She`s served her purpose.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: These men that came with me todayas an escort...
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: ...will come for her and the child tomorrow,as a firing squad.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Now, l know exactly what you think of me.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: But if you`re not coming with me,she`s not coming with me.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: So, are you coming with me?
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Do you accept the protectionof this ignoble Caliban...
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: ...on any terms that Caliban cares to make?
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Or, is your delicacy so exorbitant that youwould sacrifice a woman and a child to it?
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: There are some bags to carry, Comrades.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Comrade, there`s got to be room.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: lt`s all right, l have to bring our sledge.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Hurry. This train can`t wait.There are important people on it.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: You start, l`ll catch you up.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l`m afraid that`s it, my dear.Your young man`s not coming.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Did you really thinkhe would come with you?
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: From Mongoliahe could have gone to China.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Let him stay.You`ve come with me, haven`t you?
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: To be sure, it was your duty as a mother.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l was born out there,in the Far East, somewhere.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l think it was Mongolia. l don`t remember.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: You were born in Mongolia.And you were born that very year.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: So were a lot of other children.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Not many called Tonya, bearing the nameKomarov, or Komarovsky.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Komarov`s a common name. So is Tonya.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: With fair hair and blue eyes,lost at the age of eight...
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: ...when the civil war broke outin the Far East.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: There`s something you haven`t told me.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: How did you come to be lost?
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l don`t believe that.You must remember something.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Shall l tell youhow l first met your mother?
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: lf she was my mother, Comrade General.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l picked my brother up, literally pickedhim up, on a Moscow street.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: He had a fourth-class ration bookand he was undernourished.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: He didn`t seem to mind that, or anything.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l thought he was a happier man than me.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: He suffered me to buy him a new suit.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: And to get him a job at his old hospital.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l saw him off for his first day`s work.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: This was eight yearsafter he and Lara parted.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: So, he never saw her again?
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Thank you. You`ve been very kind to me.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: He must have known how ill he was.The walls of his heart were like paper.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: But, he kept it to himself.He kept a lot to himself.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l was astonished at the extentof his reputation.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: His work was unobtainable at the time.lt was disapproved of by the Party.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: But, if people love poetry, they love poets.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: And nobody loves poetry like a Russian.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l knew her name from the Lara poems...
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: She`d come to Moscowto look for her child.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l helped her as far as l could.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: But, l knew it was hopeless.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l think l was a little in love with her.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: One day she went awayand didn`t come back.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: ...a nameless number on a listthat was afterwards mislaid.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: That was quite common in those days.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: How did you come to be lost?
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: There were explosionsand the houses were falling down...
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: ...and he let go of my hand.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: He let go of my hand.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Would a father have done that?
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Oh, yes, people will do anything.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Don`t you want to believe it?
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Comrade General, when l was a child,l wanted parents.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: You can imagine how l wanted parents.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l wanted to die when l was a child,you know?
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l can`t be of any use to them, now, can l?
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: l was hoping l might beof some use to you.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: Yes, Comrade General. l`m an operator.
title: Doctor Zhivago

text: You`ve promised to think about it.
title: Doctor Zhivago
